attributes.comment:
DHS Docket No. USCIS- 2006-0044

I am against the proposal to increase the fee to take the citizenship test. If an
applicant, who's dedicated to following the Golden Rules, happens to fail on the
first try of taking the test, will that person have to pay again? If yes, that's just
ridiculous! Have we taken into consideration that perhaps there are so many
undocumented immigrants because they simply can't afford to do the right thing,
the right way because they can barely scrape enough money to survive? Will
applicants actually get better service, meaning faster and sufficient response? I'm
so disgusted by so-called Americans who blame immigrants for their tax
problems. I've been in deportation status since the age of 5. I'm now 23, and just
received my work authorization last year, and I'm paying tax too! I don't mind that
my parents' and my tax money is going to help baby boomers with social security
and other good causes or that it?s helping non-immigrants who depend on welfare.
There's a thing call ?tax refund? and ?caring about others? too! This nation was built
by immigrants and it will continue to stay that way! Where there's a will, there's a
way! If your intention of increasing the fee is to control amount of applicants, then
this nation will face more hate crimes and immigration issues. Please do not
increase the fee and thank you for your time.

yours truly,
Caroline Vang

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Caroline Vang
